Title: APC decries alleged maltreatment of Oshiomhole, others by Air Peace
Summary: The South-South zonal chapter of the All Progressives Congress decries alleged maltreatment of the former Governor of Edo State, Sen. Adams Oshiomhole, others by Air Peace airline .

Title: PDP accuses APC of state capture, institutional compromise, weaponising poverty
Summary: PDP accuses APC of state capture, institutional compromise, weaponising poverty . PDP raised serious concerns over what it describes as ‘state capture’ under the All Progressives Congress (APC)-led Federal Government .

Title: Varsities must score 70% in four key areas for full NUC accreditation – FG
Summary: Varsities must score at least 70% in four key areas for full NUC accreditation – FG . Academic Matters, Staffing, Physical Facilities, and Library are key areas to get full accreditation .

Title: Nigerian teen clinches top prize at WE Innovate
Summary: A 19-year-old Nigerian-born innovator, Ifeoluwa Afolayan, has emerged as one of the first-prize winners at WE Innovate, Imperial College London’s flagship pre-accelerator programme .

Title: Lagos CP commends protesters as Nigerians take to the streets
Summary: Lagos State Commissioner of Police, Jimoh Olohundare, commends Nigerians, especially Lagosians, for peacefully rallying . Lagos CP commends protesters as Nigerians take to the streets .

Title: Democracy Day: You are aiding the erosion of democratic values in Rivers, Dickson tells Tinubu
Summary: Senator Seriake Dickson (PDP, Bayelsa West) has strongly criticized President Bola Tinubu’s handling of the political crisis in Rivers State . Dickson: You are aiding the erosion of democratic values in Rivers .

Title: Make state of the nation address yearly from NASS, President Tinubu told
Summary: The National Assembly has passed a resolution calling for the institutionalization of an annual State of the Nation Address by the President, to be delivered before a joint session of the Senate and House of Representatives .

Title: Child Labour practices stealing dreams of millions of children — First lady
Summary: Nigeria’s First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, expressed deep concern over persistent issue of child labour . She described it as a practice that robs millions of children of their dreams and future .

Title: Democracy Day: We’ve not attained democratic heights envisioned – SGF
Summary: Senator George Akume reflected on Nigeria's democratic dispensation in the last 26 years . He noted that the country was still behind in attaining the heights it envisioned .

Title: Thank you Mr. President for honouring me – Onanuga
Summary: Bayo Onanuga has thanked President Bola Tinubu for honouring him with a national award of Commander Order of the Niger, CON . The Special Adviser to the President on Information and Strategy, Mr. Bayo onanuga, said he was honoured with the award .

Title: I earned $20m monthly smuggling cocaine - Escobar’s top pilot
Summary: Tirso ‘TJ’ Dominguez detailed his rise from a marijuana smuggler to one of Escobar’s most trusted transporters in the newly released Cocaine Air podcast . Born into a well-off family in Florida, he only entered drug smuggling after his father died of cancer and a bank refused to

Title: SAN urges Tinubu to name INEC headquarters after Abiola
Summary: A Senior Nigerian advocate, Dr Wahab Shittu, has urged President Bola Tinubu to name the headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission in Abuja after the late Chief MKO Abiola . The legal practitioner also urged the Federal Government to approve the release of Abiola’s entitlements to his family . Sh

Title: Osun Amotekun operative slumps while preparing for work
Summary: The leadership of Osun Amotekun Corps has announced the death of an operative, Sheriff Ogundiran, who reportedly collapsed in his house while preparing for work . The spokesperson for the corps, Yusuf Idowu, said the death left a profound void within the Corps and the larger security community in Osun State .

Title: Last surviving twin rescued by Mary Slessor dies at 115
Summary: Madam Malinda Mgbafor Okereke, otherwise called Mama Nsu Bekee, is dead . She was the last surviving female twin to be rescued by Mary Slessor, a Scottish Missionary in Arochukwu Ancient Kingdom of Abia, over a century ago . The centenarian and her twin

Title: Anambra celebrates Democracy Day without protests
Summary: Major streets across Anambra State have remained peaceful and calm and devoid of any June 12 protest currently going on in some states across the country . Both economic and commercial activities were going on without any hitch .
